cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles WSW of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: meandering in the southern Bay of Campeche through Thursday, then forecast to lift northward across the central Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast (near southeastern Louisiana) late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect along the Mexican Gulf coast from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, MX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche now; central and northern Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL) late week-end
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small (≈3%) chance of experiencing tropical-storm-force gusts late Sunday; winds otherwise below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the upper Texas coast based on current forecast track remaining well east of Galveston
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–2 inches of rain late weekend, but widespread heavy totals are not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip-current risk possible Sunday–Monday as the storm passes east of the area
